com.niton.media.crypt

Class Cluster

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.niton.media.crypt.Cluster

  • public class Cluster
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the Cluster Class A Cluster is a Class to organize a 2D byte array and move the rows and cols
    Version:
    2018-04-05
    Author:
    Niton

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Cluster(byte[] data)
      Creates an sqrt(data.length) Cluster
      Cluster(byte[][] cluster)
      Creates Cluster
      Cluster(int size)
      Creates an size*size Cluster
      Cluster(int size, byte fill)
      Creates an size*size Cluster and fills the array
      Cluster(int size, byte[] data)
      Creates an Instance of Cluster with the size as side Size and fills up with data

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte get(int col, int row)
      Returns the value from the grid at the postion col and row
      byte[] getByteArray()
      Description : Converts the Cluster to a 1D Byte array
      byte[][] getCluster()
      Description : Returns the Cluster as an 2D Byte Array
      void pushColum(int col, int push)
      Description : pushes the column downwards -> increases the index
      void pushRow(int row, int push)
      Description : equal to pushColum(int, int).
      byte set(int col, int row, byte value)
      Writes a byte to the Grid
      void setData(byte[] data)
      Sets the data to the Grid
      the data length needs to be a sqrt without after comma numbers
      java.lang.String toString()
      An String representation of the clusters data
      For Example:
      [ 1][ 4][10]
      [67][ 5][ 3]
      [ 0][19][ 8]

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cluster

        public Cluster(int size)
        Creates an size*size Cluster
        Parameters:
        size - the side size of the cluster

      • Cluster

        public Cluster(int size,
               byte fill)
        Creates an size*size Cluster and fills the array
        Parameters:
        size - the side size of the cluster
        fill - the byte to fill into the Cluster

      • Cluster

        public Cluster(int size,
               byte[] data)
        Creates an Instance of Cluster with the size as side Size and fills up with data
        Parameters:
        size - the side size to use -> should be the sqrt of data.length
        data - the data to fill in. Has to be a x^x size -> sqrt from length should be an byte

      • Cluster

        public Cluster(byte[] data)
        Creates an sqrt(data.length) Cluster
        Parameters:
        data - the array the cluster should be made of. the length has to be an sqrt() valid int

      • Cluster

        public Cluster(byte[][] cluster)
        Creates Cluster
        Parameters:
        cluster - the cluster in the right format

    • Method Detail

      • pushColum

        public void pushColum(int col,
                      int push)
        Description : pushes the column downwards -> increases the index
        Parameters:
        col - the column index to push
        push - the number how much it should be pushed

      • pushRow

        public void pushRow(int row,
                    int push)
        Description : equal to pushColum(int, int). The only difference is that a Row instead of a column is pushed
        Parameters:
        row - the row index to push
        push - how much to push

      • setData

        public void setData(byte[] data)
        Sets the data to the Grid
        the data length needs to be a sqrt without after comma numbers
        Parameters:
        data - the data to write

      • get

        public byte get(int col,
                int row)
        Returns the value from the grid at the postion col and row
        Parameters:
        col - the column where the number of your interest is -> x
        row - the row where the number of your interest is -> y
        Returns:
        the number at this position

      • set

        public byte set(int col,
                int row,
                byte value)
        Writes a byte to the Grid
        Parameters:
        col - the col (x axis) to put the value in
        row - the roq (y axis) to put the value in
        value - the value to put into the pos
        Returns:
        the byte you set

      • getCluster

        public byte[][] getCluster()
        Description : Returns the Cluster as an 2D Byte Array
        Returns:
        the cluster pure data

      • getByteArray

        public byte[] getByteArray()
        Description : Converts the Cluster to a 1D Byte array
        Returns:
        the Clusters Data as 1D Array

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        An String representation of the clusters data
        For Example:
        [ 1][ 4][10]
        [67][ 5][ 3]
        [ 0][19][ 8]
